on education and worker empowerment initiatives. The Company has established a training program for new employees at the Company&#146;s suppliers to inform them of their individual rights, local laws and the Company&#146;s Supplier Code of Conduct.
Millions of workers have participated in this training program. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company also partners with educational institutions to
offer free college-level courses to workers who make the Company&#146;s products. Hundreds of thousands of workers have attended these classes since 2008, and many have gone on to earn associate&#146;s degrees. The Company recently expanded this
educational program to offer more opportunities for participants to work toward a bachelor&#146;s degree. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company is also
active in protecting human rights and upholding its social responsibilities as they relate to its own employees throughout the world. The Company encourages a creative, culturally diverse and supportive work environment, and does not tolerate
harassment or discrimination. To support the Company&#146;s culture of inclusion, all employees are expected to respect the diverse ideas, experiences and backgrounds of all with whom we do business. In December 2013 the Company was awarded its 12th
consecutive perfect rating from the Human Rights Campaign&#146;s annual Corporate Equality Index, which scores businesses based on lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender workplace policies, and won the title of &#147;Best Places to Work for LGBT
Equality.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board does not believe that establishing a committee is an effective way for the Company&#146;s practices
and goals to continually evolve and improve in response to changing conditions. Instead, such an additional and redundant committee would distract the Board from its other responsibilities to the Company and its shareholders, while adding little
value to the Company&#146;s existing commitment to human rights and social responsibility. The Company&#146;s existing governance framework has produced a strong commitment to human rights and progress that is evident in the Company&#146;s practices
and policies. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For all of the reasons above, the Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No.&nbsp;8. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Vote Required </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Approval
of Proposal No.&nbsp;8 requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the Company&#146;s outstanding shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Recommendation of the Board
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>The Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No.&nbsp;8. </B></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">59 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PROPOSAL NO. 9 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Shareholder Proposal Entitled Report on Company Membership and Involvement with Certain Trade Associations and Business Organizations </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company has been advised that The National Center for Public Policy Research, 501 Capital Court N.E., Suite 200, Washington, DC
20002, which has indicated it is a beneficial owner of at least $2,000 in market value of the Company&#146;s common stock, intends to submit the following proposal at the Annual Meeting: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#147;STOCKHOLDER [</B><B><I>sic</I></B><B>] PROPOSAL </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>REGARDING A REPORT ON COMPANY MEMBERSHIP AND INVOLVEMENT WITH CERTAIN TRADE ASSOCIATIONS AND BUSINESS ORGANIZATIONS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Resolved: </B>Shareholders of Apple, [<I>sic</I>] Inc. (&#147;Apple&#148;) urge the board of directors (the &#147;board&#148;) to authorize the preparation of a report, updated annually, disclosing:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Apple&#146;s membership in any trade association or organization that educates members about sustainability practices, assists members in the development of
sustainability practices, encourages members to engage in sustainability practices or requires members to undertake sustainability actions. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Payments made by Apple to trade associations or organizations of which Apple is a member that meet any of the definitions set forth in #1, above.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Registration with, membership in or subscription to any independent sustainability rating processes, registries and/or organizations to which Apple makes payments that
rate Apple products for sustainability purposes and intentionally make results of such evaluations, in whole or in part, available to the public. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The amount of payments made by Apple to entities that meet any of the definitions set forth in #3, above. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The report, excluding proprietary information and information related to legal compliance, shall be presented to the Audit and Finance
Committee of the board or other relevant oversight committees of the board and posted on Apple&#146;s website. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes
of this proposal, &#147;sustainability&#148; refers to practices relating to the conservation of energy or physical resources; &#147;trade association&#148; refers to, as defined by Merriam-Webster, &#147;an association of tradesmen, businessmen, or
manufacturers in a particular trade or industry for the protection and advancement of their common interests&#148;; &#147;independent&#148; refers to organizations or entities not owned or wholly controlled by Apple or by any government body or
agent thereof; &#147;payments&#148; refers to fees paid for membership, subscription or registration purposes to sustainability ratings organizations or their parent organizations or agents and does not refer to nor include fees paid to news media
organizations, including trade publications, their parent companies or agents, or any payments made solely for advertising purposes. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Supporting statement: </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Some trade associations and business organizations have expanded beyond the promotion of traditional business goals and are lobbying
business executives to pursue objectives with primarily social benefits. This may affect Company profitability and shareholder value. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company&#146;s involvement and acquiescence in these endeavors lacks transparency, and publicly-available information about the Company&#146;s trade association memberships and related activities is
minimal. An annual report to shareholders will help protect shareholder value.&#148; </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">60 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>The Company&#146;s Statement in Opposition to Proposal No.&nbsp;9 </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No.&nbsp;9. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company believes that selective participation in trade associations and business organizations is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders. The Company is constantly monitoring and
reviewing its participation and membership in associations and initiatives, and believes the reporting that would be required by this proposal is not necessary to protect shareholder value. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Participation in trade organizations can provide significant benefits to the Company and its shareholders. For example, participation in
a trade organization may be an effective way to support specific policy initiatives or positions the Company believes will be in its best interests. The Company carefully chooses which organizations to join and chooses only those that advance the
Company&#146;s business interests. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The proposal alleges that some trade associations are lobbying business executives to
pursue objectives with primarily social benefits. This is not consistent with the Company&#146;s experience. Trade associations generally act on behalf of their members&#146; interests, rather than lobbying their own members as the proposal
suggests. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company may pay membership or other fees to trade organizations from time to time. But the Company&#146;s
existing Political Contributions and Expenditures Policy does not permit trade association fees paid by the Company to be used to make political contributions. The Political Contributions and Expenditures Policy also requires that the Company&#146;s
management annually report the Company&#146;s memberships and participation in trade organizations to the Company&#146;s Board. The Political Contributions and Expenditures Policy is published on the Company&#146;s website. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company believes the report that would be required by Proposal No.&nbsp;9 would be potentially misleading to the shareholders and the
public because it would not necessarily reflect the Company&#146;s views. Disclosure of the Company&#146;s participations in trade associations could also impact the Company&#146;s competitiveness by highlighting the Company&#146;s priorities and
strategic interests. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company also obtains ratings for its products and joins product registries when it determines these
actions are in the Company&#146;s best interests. The Company constantly reviews and assesses ratings organizations and their processes to ensure that they are aligned with the Company&#146;s standards and business interests. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board believes the Company&#146;s current disclosure policies and other internal policies are sufficient to manage the issues
outlined in the proposal. The Board also believes that producing the report requested by Proposal No.&nbsp;9 would not be an effective way to protect shareholder value. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For all of the reasons above, the Board recommends a vote against Proposal No.&nbsp;9. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Vote
Required </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Approval of Proposal No.&nbsp;9 requires the affirmative vote of (i)&nbsp;a majority of the shares present or
represented by proxy and voting at the Annual Meeting and (ii)&nbsp;a majority of the shares required to constitute the quorum. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Recommendation of the Board </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>The Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No.&nbsp;9. </B></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">61 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PROPOSAL NO. 10 </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Shareholder Proposal of a Non-Binding Advisory Resolution Relating to the Company&#146;s Capital Return Program </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:0px; "><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company has been advised that High River Limited Partnership (&#147;<I>High River</I>&#148;), 767 Fifth Avenue,
46</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">th</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> Floor, New York, New York, 10153, a record holder of
1,000 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock, intends to submit the following proposal at the Annual Meeting on behalf of itself and Icahn Partners LP, Icahn Partners Master Fund LP, Icahn Partners Master Fund II LP, Icahn Partners Master Fund
III LP, and other beneficial owners, including Mr.&nbsp;Carl Icahn: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;RESOLVED, that the shareholders hereby approve, on
an advisory basis, High River&#146;s proposal that Apple commit to completing not less than $50 billion of share repurchases during Apple&#146;s fiscal year ending September&nbsp;27, 2014 (and increase the amount authorized for share repurchases
under its Capital Return Program accordingly).&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>The Company&#146;s Statement in Opposition to Proposal No.&nbsp;10 </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No.&nbsp;10. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board and management team are thoughtfully considering options for returning additional cash to shareholders and are currently seeking input from shareholders as part of the Company&#146;s regular
review. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company&#146;s success stems from the Company&#146;s unique ability to combine world-class skills in hardware,
software and services to deliver innovative products that create new markets and delight hundreds of millions of customers. This success has created tremendous value for the Company&#146;s shareholders. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With breakthrough products and services such as the Mac, iPod, iPhone, iPad and App Store, the Company has created huge market
opportunities, and the Board and management team believe the opportunities that lie ahead are just as exciting. Given such large and global markets, the Company competes with large companies around the world, many with their own significant
technical capabilities and significant capital. This dynamic competitive landscape and the Company&#146;s rapid pace of innovation require unprecedented investment, flexibility and access to resources. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Successfully innovating and executing against these large opportunities also requires careful stewardship by the Board and management
team, and the Company&#146;s evaluation of capital return is conducted in the context of supporting the Company&#146;s continued business success and desire to deliver attractive returns to long-term shareholders. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board and management team have demonstrated a strong commitment to returning capital to shareholders over the past two years. In
March 2012, the Company announced a quarterly dividend and share repurchase program totaling $45 billion. In April 2013, the Board authorized a dramatic increase, more than doubling the size of the program to $100 billion, raising the dividend, and
increasing the share buyback authorization to $60 billion. As such, the Company is one of the largest dividend payers in the world and has the largest share repurchase authorization in history. The Company has executed aggressively against the
capital return program, spending $23 billion of the $60 billion share repurchase authorization in fiscal 2013 alone. These share repurchases have been funded in part by a $17 billion debt offering, the largest ever as of the time of issuance.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the first six quarters of the capital return program, dividend payments and share repurchases totaled over $43 billion.
Dividends and share repurchases must be funded by domestic cash, and the Company has returned to shareholders or invested all of the domestic cash generated by its business and raised through the issuance of debt since the beginning of the program.
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">62 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">While the Board and management oppose this shareholder proposal, they are fully committed to
returning cash to shareholders. The Board and management team believe that capital should be returned to shareholders on an efficient and sustained basis, and that the evaluation of capital return should be performed regularly and carefully with the
best long-term interest of the business and shareholders in mind. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company is updating perspectives on its capital return
program for 2014 and beyond. The Company is collecting input from a very broad base of shareholders, believing that the input of all shareholders is important and should be considered holistically. The evaluation of the capital return program
continues to be thoughtful, deliberate, and consistent with a conservative financial policy that supports risk-taking and innovation. Consistent with its pattern for the last two years, the Company is on track to complete its regular review and
thorough analysis and to announce any changes to the current program by March or April of 2014. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board believes that the
Company&#146;s management team and Board are in the best position to determine what is in the best long-term interest of the Company&#146;s business and recommends a vote AGAINST this proposal. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Vote Required </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Approval
of Proposal No.&nbsp;10 requires the affirmative vote of (i)&nbsp;a majority of the shares present or represented by proxy and voting at the Annual Meeting and (ii)&nbsp;a majority of the shares required to constitute the quorum. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Recommendation of the Board </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>The Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No.&nbsp;10. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PROPOSAL NO.
11 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Shareholder Proposal Entitled Proxy Access for Shareholders </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company has been advised that James McRitchie, 9295 Yorkship Court, Elk Grove, CA 95758, who has indicated he is a beneficial owner
of at least $2,000 in market value of the Company&#146;s common stock, intends to submit the following proposal at the Annual Meeting: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;Proposal 11&#151;Proxy Access for Shareholders </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, more than 10% of
Apple Inc. shareholders voted against the re-election of three directors in 2013. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The business case for boardroom diversity
runs deep, with studies finding higher returns on sales, invested capital and equity. Yet, Apple&#146;s board consists of seven white males and one Chinese-American woman, all aged 52 [<I>sic</I>] to 72 [<I>sic</I>]. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Apple continues to face a litany of legal issues: possible worker rights violations at suppliers, anti-competitive practices, consumer
class-action lawsuits, anti-trust probes, and consumer privacy concerns. Yet, Apple lacks a board committee responsible for these issues. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Activist corporate raiders have offered creative ideas aimed at capturing the cash horde, but not enhancing long-term returns. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">It is time to &#147;think different&#148; by allowing shareowners to be heard on the board. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">63 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">RESOLVED, Shareowners ask our board, to the fullest extent permitted by law, to amend our
governing documents to allow shareowners to make board nominations as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1. The Company proxy statement, form of proxy,
and voting instruction forms shall include, listed with the board&#146;s nominees, alphabetically by last name, nominees of: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a. Any party of one or more shareowners that has collectively held, continuously for two years, at least one percent but less than five
percent of the Company&#146;s securities eligible to vote for the election of directors, and/or </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b. Any party of shareowners
of whom 25 or more have each held continuously for one year a number of shares of the Company&#146;s stock that, at some point within the preceding 60 days, was worth at least $2,000 and collectively at least one percent but less than five percent
of the Company&#146;s securities eligible to vote for the election of directors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2. For any board election, no shareowner may
be a member of more than one such nominating party. Board members and officers of the Company may not be members of any such nominating party of shareowners. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3. Parties nominating under 1(a) may collectively, and parties nominating under 1(b) may collectively, make nominations numbering up to 24% of the company&#146;s board of directors. If either group should
exceed its 24% limit, opportunities to nominate shall be distributed among parties in that group as evenly as possible. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. If
necessary, preference among 1(a) nominators will be shown to those holding the greatest number of the Company&#146;s shares for at least two years, and preference among 1(b) nominators will be shown to those with the greatest number who have each
held continuously for one year a number of shares of the Company&#146;s stock that, at some point within the preceding 60 days, was worth at least $2,000. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. Nominees may include in the proxy statement a 500 word supporting statement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6. Each proxy statement or special meeting notice to elect board members shall include instructions for nominating under these
provisions, fully explaining all legal requirements for nominators and nominees under federal law, state law and the company&#146;s governing documents. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Vote to protect and enhance shareholder value: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Proxy Access for
Shareholders&#151;Proposal 11&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>The Company&#146;s Statement in Opposition to Proposal No.&nbsp;11 </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No.&nbsp;11. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company&#146;s Nominating Committee assists the Board in identifying qualified individuals to become directors, including considering candidates proposed by shareholders. In identifying nominees, the
Committee considers, among other things, a candidate&#146;s independence, character, ability to exercise sound judgment, diversity, age, demonstrated leadership, skills, including financial literacy, and experience in the context of the needs of the
Board. The Board believes that the Board and the Nominating Committee are best situated to assess the particular qualifications of potential director nominees and determine whether they will contribute to an effective Board that addresses the
evolving needs of the Company and represents the best interests of the Company&#146;s shareholders. The Board believes that providing access to the Company&#146;s proxy as set forth in the proposal will undermine the value to the Company&#146;s
shareholders of the selection and nomination process undertaken by the Nominating Committee and the Board. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Members of the
Board and the Nominating Committee have a fiduciary duty to act in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders. The Board is also accountable to the Company&#146;s shareholders through the Company&#146;s corporate governance documents and
policies, including having all directors elected annually by the </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">64 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
shareholders. Instead of this system of accountability, the proposal would provide for access to the Company&#146;s proxy by individual shareholders or relatively small groups of shareholders who
do not have a similar fiduciary duty, are not bound by the Company&#146;s corporate governance policies and practices, and may nominate directors who advance their own specific agenda without regard to the best interests of the Company or its
shareholders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company also believes that the proposal is unnecessary because the Nominating Committee already considers
candidates proposed by shareholders and evaluates them using the same criteria as for other candidates. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With respect to the
proponent&#146;s specific proposal, the Board believes that the proposed thresholds for proxy access are inappropriately low and not in the best interests of the Company or its shareholders. In particular, the thresholds in the proposal would
provide access to shareholders with an extremely limited interest in the Company, relative to the overall size of the Company and the total number of shareholders. The thresholds in the proposal would only require that (i)&nbsp;one or more
shareholders own at least 1% of the outstanding shares of the Company for a minimum of two years continuously, or (ii)&nbsp;a group of 25 or more shareholders each own at least $2,000 of the Company&#146;s shares for one year continuously.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These low thresholds do not demonstrate a significant and sustained long-term commitment to the Company sufficient to justify
the costs and disruption of this kind of broadly available access to the Company&#146;s proxy statement. Further, the low thresholds could result in the inclusion of multiple proxy access nominees in the Company&#146;s proxy materials, leading to
significant additional expense and diversion of the Board&#146;s and management&#146;s time and energy supporting the Board&#146;s nominees in contested elections. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For all of the reasons above, the Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No.&nbsp;11. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Vote
Required </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Approval of Proposal No.&nbsp;11 requires the affirmative vote of (i)&nbsp;a majority of the shares present or
represented by proxy and voting at the Annual Meeting and (ii)&nbsp;a majority of the shares required to constitute the quorum. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Recommendation of the Board </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>The Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No.&nbsp;11. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>OTHER MATTERS
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">An eligible shareholder has separately notified us of his intent to present the Floor Proposal (described above) at the
Annual Meeting. If approved, the Floor Proposal would, among other things, ask the Board &#147;to&nbsp;enact a policy to use technical methods and other best practices to protect user data.&#148; The Company knows of no other matters to be submitted
to the shareholders at the Annual Meeting, other than the proposals referred to in this Proxy Statement and&nbsp;the possible submission of the&nbsp;Floor&nbsp;Proposal. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Floor Proposal was not submitted under Rule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act and the shareholder did not seek to have the Floor Proposal included in this Proxy Statement. Accordingly, the Floor Proposal
may be presented at the meeting but is not included in this Proxy Statement. If the Floor Proposal is presented at the Annual Meeting, then to the extent permitted by applicable rules, the proxy holders will have, and intend to exercise,
discretionary voting authority under Rule 14a-4(c) under the Exchange Act to vote AGAINST the Floor Proposal. If any other matters properly come before the shareholders at the Annual Meeting, it is the intention of the persons named on the proxy to
vote the shares represented thereby on such matters in accordance with their best judgment. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Dated: January&nbsp;10, 2014 </FONT></P>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">65 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ANNEX A </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AMENDED AND RESTATED ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION OF APPLE&nbsp;INC. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AMENDED AND RESTATED ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>OF </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>APPLE INC. </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>I </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The
name of the corporation is Apple Inc. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>II </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The purpose of this corporation is to engage in any lawful act or activity for which a corporation may be organized under the General Corporation Law of California other than the banking business, the
trust company business or the practice of a profession permitted to be incorporated by the California Corporations Code. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>III </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This corporation is authorized to issue one class of shares designated &#147;Common Stock,&#148; par value $0.00001 per share. The number
of shares of Common Stock that this corporation is authorized to issue is 1,800,000,000. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>IV </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;1.<I> Limitation of Directors&#146; Liability</I>. The liability of the directors of this corporation for monetary damages
shall be eliminated to the fullest extent permissible under California law. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;2.<I> Indemnification of Corporate
Agents</I>. The corporation is authorized to provide indemnification of agents (as defined in Section&nbsp;317 of the California Corporations Code) through bylaw provisions, agreements with agents, vote of shareholders or disinterested directors or
otherwise, in excess of the indemnification otherwise permitted by Section&nbsp;317 of the California Corporations Code, subject only to the applicable limits set forth in Section&nbsp;204 of the California Corporations Code with respect to actions
for breach of duty to the corporation and its shareholders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;3.<I> Repeal or Modification</I>. Any repeal or
modification of the foregoing provisions of this Article IV by the shareholders of this corporation shall not adversely affect any right or protection of an agent of this corporation existing at the time of such repeal or modification. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>V </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">There
shall be no right with respect to shares of stock of this corporation to cumulate votes in the election of directors. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A-1
</FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">ANNEX B </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">MARKED COPY OF </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">AMENDED AND RESTATED ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION OF APPLE&nbsp;INC.
</FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AMENDED AND RESTATED ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>OF </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>APPLE INC. </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>I </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The
name of the corporation is Apple Inc. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>II </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The purpose of this corporation is to engage in any lawful act or activity for which a corporation may be organized under the General Corporation Law of California other than the banking business, the
trust company business or the practice of a profession permitted to be incorporated by the California Corporations Code. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>III </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This corporation is authorized to issue <STRIKE>two classes</STRIKE><U STYLE="border-bottom:0.5pt double; padding-bottom:0.5pt">one
class</U> of shares designated <STRIKE>respectively</STRIKE> &#147;Common Stock<STRIKE>&#148; and &#147;Preferred Stock.&#148;</STRIKE><U STYLE="border-bottom:0.5pt double; padding-bottom:0.5pt">,</U><U>&#148; par value $0.00001 per share.</U> The
number of shares of Common Stock <STRIKE>which</STRIKE><U STYLE="border-bottom:0.5pt double; padding-bottom:0.5pt">that</U> this corporation is authorized to issue is 1,800,000,000<U STYLE="border-bottom:0.5pt double; padding-bottom:0.5pt">.</U>
<STRIKE>The number of shares of Preferred Stock which this corporation is authorized to issue is 5,000,000.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>IV</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>The Preferred Stock may be issued from time to time in one or more series. The Board of Directors is authorized to fix the number of shares of
any series of Preferred Stock and to determine the designation of any such series. The Board of Directors is further authorized to determine or alter the rights, preferences, privileges and restrictions granted to or imposed upon any wholly unissued
series of Preferred Stock and, within the limits and restrictions stated in any resolution or resolutions of the Board of Directors originally fixing the number of shares constituting any series, to increase or decrease (but not below the number of
shares of each series outstanding) the number of shares of any such series subsequent to the issuance of shares of that series.</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>V</STRIKE> <U STYLE="border-bottom:0.5pt double; padding-bottom:0.5pt">IV</U> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;1.<I> Limitation of Directors&#146; Liability</I>. The liability of the directors of this corporation for monetary damages shall be eliminated to the fullest extent permissible under
California law. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;2.<I> Indemnification of Corporate Agents</I>. The corporation is authorized to provide
indemnification of agents (as defined in Section&nbsp;317 of the California Corporations Code) through bylaw provisions, agreements with agents, vote of shareholders or disinterested directors or otherwise, in excess of the indemnification otherwise
permitted by Section&nbsp;317 of the California Corporations Code, subject only to the applicable limits set forth in Section&nbsp;204 of the California Corporations Code with respect to actions for breach of duty to the corporation and its
shareholders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;3.<I> Repeal or Modification</I>. Any repeal or modification of the foregoing provisions of this
Article&nbsp;<STRIKE>V</STRIKE><U STYLE="border-bottom:0.5pt double; padding-bottom:0.5pt">IV</U> by the shareholders of this corporation shall not adversely affect any right or protection of an agent of this corporation existing at the time of such
repeal or modification. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">B-1
</FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>VI</STRIKE> <U STYLE="border-bottom:0.5pt double; padding-bottom:0.5pt">V</U></B>
<B> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">There shall be no right with respect to shares of stock of this corporation to cumulate votes in the election of
directors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>VII</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>Through and until immediately prior to the annual meeting of shareholders to be held in fiscal year 2000, the directors shall be divided into two classes, designated Class I and Class II, each
consisting of one-half of the directors or as close an approximation as possible, and each director shall serve for a term running until the second annual meeting of shareholders succeeding his or her election and until his or her successor shall
have been duly elected and qualified; provided, however, that the terms of all directors shall expire at the annual meeting of shareholders to be held in fiscal year 2000. Commencing at the annual meeting of shareholders to be held in fiscal year
2000, each director shall be elected to serve until the annual meeting of shareholders held in the following fiscal year or until his or her successor shall have been duly elected and qualified.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>VIII</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>The Certificate of Determination of Preferences of Series A Non-Voting Convertible Preferred Stock, filed on August&nbsp;6, 1997, a copy of which is attached hereto as Exhibit A, is hereby
incorporated by reference as Article VIII.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">B-2
</FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>EXHIBIT A</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>CERTIFICATE OF DETERMINATION OF PREFERENCES OF</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>SERIES A NON-VOTING CONVERTIBLE PREFERRED STOCK</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>AS FILED WITH THE SECRETARY OF STATE OF THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>ON AUGUST&nbsp;6, 1997</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">B-3
</FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><STRIKE>Conformed Copy as filed with the Secretary of State</STRIKE> </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><STRIKE>of the State of California on August&nbsp;6, 1997</STRIKE> </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>CERTIFICATE OF DETERMINATION OF</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>PREFERENCES OF SERIES A NON-VOTING CONVERTIBLE PREFERRED STOCK</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>OF APPLE COMPUTER, INC.</STRIKE> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>The undersigned, John B.
Douglas, III, and Paul D. Carmichael, hereby certify that:</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>1. They are a duly elected Senior Vice President
and Assistant Secretary, respectively, of Apple Computer, Inc., a California corporation (the &#147;Corporation&#148;).</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>2. The Corporation hereby designates one hundred and fifty thousand (150,000)&nbsp;shares of Series A Non-Voting Convertible Preferred Stock.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>3. None of the shares of the Series A Non-Voting Convertible Preferred Stock have been issued.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>4. Pursuant to authority given by the Corporation&#146;s Restated Articles of Incorporation, the Board of Directors of the
Corporation has duly adopted the following recitals and resolutions:</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE><B>WHEREAS</B>, the Restated Articles
of Incorporation of the Corporation provide for a class of shares known as Preferred Stock, issuable from time to time in one or more series; and</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE><B>WHEREAS</B>, the Board of Directors of the Corporation is authorized within the limitations and restrictions stated in the Restated Articles of Incorporation to determine or alter the rights,
preferences, privileges and restrictions granted to or imposed on any wholly unissued series of Preferred Stock, to fix the number of shares constituting any such series, and to determine the designation thereof; and</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE><B>WHEREAS</B>, the Corporation has not issued any shares of Preferred Stock, and the Board of Directors of this Corporation
desires to determine the rights, preferences, privileges and restrictions relating to this initial series of Preferred Stock, and the number of shares constituting said series, and the designation of said series;</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE>NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT</STRIKE></B><STRIKE> <B></B></STRIKE><B> </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE><B>RESOLVED:</B> That the President and the Secretary of this Corporation are each authorized to execute, verify and file a
certificate of determination of preferences with respect to the Series A Non-Voting Convertible Preferred Stock in accordance with the laws of the State of California.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE><B>RESOLVED FURTHER:</B> That the Board of Directors hereby determines the rights, preferences, privileges and restrictions
relating to said series of Series A Non-Voting Convertible Preferred Stock shall be as set forth below.</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>&#147;A. One hundred and fifty thousand (150,000)&nbsp;of the authorized shares of Preferred Stock of the Corporation, none of which have been issued or are outstanding, are hereby designated
&#147;Series A Non-Voting Convertible Preferred Stock&#148; (the &#147;Series A Preferred Stock&#148;).</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>B. The rights, preferences, privileges, restrictions and other matters relating to the Series A Preferred Stock are as follows:</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>1. <B>Dividend Rights.</B> The holders of outstanding shares of Series A Preferred Stock shall be entitled to
receive, when and as declared by the Board of Directors, out of any assets at the time legally</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">B-4
</FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
<STRIKE>available therefor, a dividend at the rate of 3% of the Original Issue Price per share per annum, payable in preference and priority to any payment of any dividend on Common Stock of the
Corporation. If, in any twelve month period, the Board of Directors declares dividends on the Common Stock that would exceed the dividends declared on the Series A Preferred Stock in such period determined on a Common Share Equivalent Basis (as
defined below), the Board shall declare and pay an equivalent additional dividend on the Series A Preferred Stock so that the total dividends on the Common Stock and the Series A Preferred Stock are on a parity determined on a Common Share
Equivalent Basis. Common Share Equivalent Basis shall be determined by comparing the dividend that would have been or will be declared or paid on the number of shares of Common Stock into which the shares of Series A Preferred Stock would have been
or will be convertible as of the record date(s) to the dividends which were paid or will be paid on the Common Stock during such twelve month period. The right to receive dividends on shares of Series A Preferred Stock shall not be cumulative, and
no right to such dividends shall accrue to holders of Series A Preferred Stock by reason of the fact that dividends on said shares are not declared or paid in any year. The Original Issue Price of the Series A Preferred Stock (as adjusted for any
combination, consolidation, share distributions or share dividends with respect to such shares) shall be equal to $1,000 per share.</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>2. <B>Voting Rights</B>. Except as otherwise provided by law, the holders of Series A Preferred Stock shall have no voting rights and their consent shall not be required for taking any corporate
action.</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>3. <B>Liquidation, Dissolution or Winding Up</B>. Subject to any preferential
liquidation rights of any series of Preferred Stock as may then be outstanding, in the event of any liquidation, dissolution or winding up of the Corporation, either voluntary or involuntary, the entire assets and funds of the Corporation legally
available for distribution shall be distributed ratably among the holders of the Common Stock and the Series A Preferred Stock in proportion to, in the case of holders of Common Stock, the number of shares of Common Stock held and, in the case of
holders of Series A Preferred Stock, the number of shares of Common Stock into which the shares of Series A Preferred Stock are then convertible.</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>4. <B>Consolidation, Merger, Exchange, Etc.</B> In case the Corporation shall enter into any consolidation, merger, combination, statutory share exchange or other transaction in which the Common
Stock is exchanged for or changed into other shares or securities, money and/or any other property, then in any such case the Series A Preferred Stock shall at the same time be either, at the option of the Corporation, (a)&nbsp;similarly exchanged
or changed into preferred shares of the surviving entity providing the holders of the Series A Preferred Stock with (to the extent possible) the same relative rights and preferences as the Series A Preferred Stock or (b)&nbsp;converted into the
shares of stock and other securities, money and/or any other property receivable upon or deemed to be held by holders of Common Stock immediately following such consolidation, merger, combination, statutory share exchange or other transaction, and
the holders of the Series A Preferred Stock shall be entitled upon such event to receive such amount of securities, money and/or any other property as the shares of the Common Stock of the Corporation into which such shares of Series A Preferred
Stock could have been converted immediately prior to such consolidation, merger, combination, statutory share exchange or other transaction would have been entitled.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE><B>5. Conversion.</B></STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>(a) Each share of Series A Preferred Stock shall automatically be converted into such number of fully paid and
nonassessable shares of Common Stock as is determined by dividing the Original Issue Price by the Conversion Price in effect at the time of the conversion upon any sale, pledge, conveyance, hypothecation, assignment or other transfer of such share,
whether or not for value, or attempt thereof, by the initial registered holder thereof, other than any such transfer by such holder to a nominee of such holder (without any change in beneficial ownership, as such term is defined under
Section&nbsp;13(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;)); provided that any transfer by the initial registered holder to any majority-owned subsidiary</STRIKE> <STRIKE>of the initial registered holder
shall not give rise to automatic conversion hereunder unless and until such transferee ceases to be a majority-owned subsidiary of the initial registered holder; and further provided that in the event any pledge, conveyance, hypothecation,
assignment or other transfer shall not give rise to automatic conversion hereunder, then any subsequent</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">B-5
</FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
<STRIKE>transfer or attempt thereof by the holder (other than any such transfer by such holder to a nominee of such holder (without any change in beneficial ownership, as such term is defined
under Section&nbsp;13(d) of the Exchange Act) shall be subject to automatic conversion upon the terms and conditions set forth herein. The price at which shares of Common Stock shall be deliverable upon conversion shall initially $16.50 with respect
to shares of Series A Preferred Stock (the &#147;Conversion Price&#148;). The initial Conversion Price shall be subject to adjustment as provided below.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>(b) The Corporation shall at all times reserve and keep available out of its authorized but unissued shares of
Common Stock, solely for the purpose of effecting the conversion of the shares of the Series A Preferred Stock, such number of its shares of Common Stock as shall from time to time be sufficient to effect the conversion of all outstanding shares of
Series A Preferred Stock.</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><STRIKE></STRIKE></B><STRIKE>6. <B>Adjustment of Conversion for Dividend
and Distributions</B>. <B></B></STRIKE><B></B> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>(a) In the event the Corporation shall at any time
after issuance of the Series A Preferred Stock declare or pay any dividend or other distribution on Common Stock, payable in Common Stock or other securities or rights convertible into, or exchangeable for, Common Stock, or effect a subdivision or
combination or consolidation of the outstanding Common Stock (by reclassification or otherwise) into a greater or lesser number of Common Stock, then in each such case the number of Common Stock issuable upon the conversion of the Series A Preferred
Stock shall be adjusted (the &#147;Adjustment&#148;) by multiplying the number of Common Stock to which the holder was entitled before such event by a fraction, the numerator of which will be the number of shares of Common Stock outstanding
immediately after such event, and the denominator of which will be the number of shares of Common Stock that were outstanding immediately prior to such event.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>(b) In the event the Corporation shall at any time after issuance of the Series A Preferred Stock, distribute to
holders of its Common Stock, other than as part of a dissolution or liquidation or the winding up of its affairs, any shares of its capital stock, any evidence of indebtedness, or other securities or any of its assets (other than Common Stock or
securities convertible into or exchangeable for Common Stock), then, in any such case, the Series A Preferred Stock holder shall be entitled to receive, at the same time as such distribution is made to the holders of Common Stock, with respect to
each share of Common Stock issuable upon such conversion, the amount of cash or evidence of indebtedness or other securities or assets which such Series A Preferred Stock holder would have been entitled to receive with respect to each such share of
Common Stock as a result of the happening of such event had the Series A Preferred Stock holder converted to Common Stock immediately prior to the record date or other date determining the shareholders entitled to participate in such distribution
(the &#147;Determination Date&#148;).</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>7. <B>Minimal Adjustments</B>. No adjustment in the
Original Issue Price need be made if such adjustment would result in a change in the Conversion Price of less than $0.01. Any adjustment of less than $0.01 which is not made shall be carried forward and shall be made at the time of and together with
any subsequent adjustment which, on a cumulative basis, amounts to an adjustment of $0.01 or more in the Conversion Price.</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>8. <B>Fractional Shares</B>. In lieu of any fractional shares to which the holder of the Series A Preferred Stock would otherwise be entitled, the Corporation shall pay cash equal to such fraction
multiplied by the closing price of one share of the Corporation&#146;s Common Stock on the trading day prior to conversion, if such price is available. If such price is not available, this Corporation shall pay cash for</STRIKE> <STRIKE>fractional
shares equal to such fraction multiplied by the fair market value of one share of Series A Preferred Stock as determined by the Board of Directors of the Corporation. Whether or not fractional shares are issuable upon such conversion shall be
determined on the basis of the total number of shares of Series A Preferred Stock of each holder at the time converting into Common Stock and the number of shares of Common Stock issuable upon such aggregate conversion.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>9. <B>Vote to Change the Terms of Series A Preferred Stock</B>. The approval of the Board of Directors and the
affirmative vote at a meeting duly called by the Board of Directors for such purpose (or</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">B-6
</FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
<STRIKE>the written consent without a meeting) of the holders of not less than fifty percent (50%)&nbsp;of the then outstanding shares of Series A Preferred Stock shall be required to amend,
alter, change or repeal any of the powers, designations, preferences and rights of the Series A Preferred Stock.</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>10. <B>No Other Rights, Privileges, Etc.</B> Except as specifically set forth herein, the holders of the Series A Preferred Stock shall have no other rights, privileges or preferences with respect
to the Series A Preferred Stock.</STRIKE> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B>, the undersigned each declares under penalty of
perjury that the matters set out in the foregoing certificate are true of his own knowledge, and the undersigned have executed this certificate at Cupertino, California as of the 5th day of August, 1997.</STRIKE> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><STRIKE>Assistant Secretary</STRIKE></FONT></P></TD></TR>
